intro: Tropilis aemula, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse easily by wind. Tropilis aemula is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
